class.title: Publication Design
class.description: This advanced class will focus on the creative development, design and production of publications using Adobe software applications. The primary focus is the concept development, design and production of both traditional multi-paged documents, such as books, magazines and/or newspapers, and non-traditional hand-made artists books. Lecture presented online, required lab Wednesdays only on campus. Prerequisite: ARTC 1313 or instructor approval is required. Questions? Call Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308 or e-mail LCollins@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Cultural Studies
class.description: Mexico: A Cultural Perspective. This theme-driven, multicultural interdisciplinary course will focus on comparisons between the USA trading partner and neighbor to the south. Movies! Food! No textbook! No tests! Lectures on Maya, Aztecs, Spaniards, astronomy, race, class and gender, artists, musicians, Chicano writers, photography, business culture.

class.title: Cultural Studies
class.description: This course focuses on topics related to Caribbean culture and the arts, with special emphasis on the impact of the African influence within the broader Caribbean, Central, and South American regions.

class.title: Composition II
class.description: This course will examine literature concerning civil disobedience and nonviolent resistance movements in the 20th century. Readings, lectures, films, guest speakers and presentations will include the work of Gandhi, Martin Luther King, John Lewis, Thich Nhat Hahn and contemporary peace activists. Through this course, students will develop the necessary research and writing skills to create awareness of social issues and promote change.

Through this course, students will develop the necessary research and writing skills to create awareness of social issues and promote change.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: This course will explore the trials and tribulations of a variety of heroes in their journeys toward enlightenment. Through this exploration, students will examine their own personal journeys in relation to the collective human experience.
class.alt-description: This course will explore the trials and tribulations of a variety of heroes in their journeys toward enlightenment. Through this exploration, students will examine their own personal journeys in relation to the collective human experience.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: This course will explore the trials and tribulations of a variety of heroes in their journeys toward enlightenment. Through this exploration, students will examine their own personal journeys in relations to the collective human experience.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: The Holocaust and other Genocides: By focusing on the literature of the Holocaust (1939-1945) as well as historical readings and lectures, this course will show how people can be led to believe in the necessity of destroying their fellow human beings and the disasters which result. This course will include a visit to the Dallas Memorial Center for Holocaust Studies and lectures from survivors and liberators of the concentration camps.
class.alt-description: The Holocaust and other Genocides: By focusing on the literature of the Holocaust (1939-1945) as well as historical readings and lectures, this course will show how people can be led to believe in the necessity of destroying their fellow human beings and the disasters which result. This course will include a visit to the Dallas Memorial Center for Holocaust Studies and lectures from survivors and liberators of the concentration camps.

class.title: Learning Framework
class.description: HDEV 1300 will help students develop skills that will support their success in college. Topics include, but are not limited to: motivation and self-discipline, time management, effective communication, test taking skills, reading/writing techniques, note taking, and the development of critical thinking.
class.alt-description: Used books are not acceptable for this course.

class.title: Web Page Design I
class.description: IMED 1316-2001 will focus on designing standard compliant websites for the Internet using HTML, XHTML and CSS as well as creating and preparing graphics for use on Web pages. Dreamweaver will be introduced. On-campus sections are taught in a Macintosh computer lab. Questions? Call Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308 or e-mail at LCollins@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Web Page Design I
class.description: IMED 1316-2426 The orientation for this class is online. Login to the class and follow directions in the announcement. The focus will be on designing standard compliant Web sites for the Internet using HTML, XHTML and CSS, as well as creating and preparing graphics for use on Web pages. Requires access to the Internet using a current browser (not AOL), e-mail, Dreamweaver and Photoshop software for your particular operating systems. Questions? Call Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308, e-mail LCollins@dcccd.edu or visit the TeleCollege Web site at http://telecollege.dcccd.edu.

class.title: Music Literature
class.description: Please call Octavio Gutierrez at 972-860-4720 for more information. Orientation is Jan. 16 at 1:30 p.m., Room D207. If the institution to which the student wishes to transfer requires only one music literature course, the student should take MUSI 1308. If it requires two literature courses, the student should take MUSI 1308 and MUSI 1309. In the latter case, MUSI 1308 meets the Humanities/Visual and Performing Arts requirement. These courses are taught in English with a bilingual instructor.

class.title: Prin of Nutrit
class.description: In addition to learning how the body handles nutrients, students analyze personal eating habits; develop a personal weight control plan; analyze food labels; distinguish between nutrition fact and myth; identify relationships between nutrition and disease; and integrate nutrition information into daily lives. All sections have an Internet component; students must have Internet access and an e-mail address.
class.alt-description: In addition to learning how the body handles nutrients, students analyze personal eating habits; develop a personal weight control plan; analyze food labels; distinguish between nutrition fact and myth; identify relationships between nutrition and disease; and integrate nutrition information into daily lives. All sections have an Internet component; students must have Internet access and an e-mail address.

class.title: Prin of Nutrit
class.description: This section has the same course description as Sections 2001 and 2003 with the following exception: it has a modified Tuesday/Thursday class meeting schedule. Some class meetings will be traditional and others will be assigned group activities and/or Internet activities. Details will be discussed at first class meeting. Students must have Internet access and e-mail address.

class.title: Beginning Tai Chi Chuan
class.description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form characterized by low, non-impact movements designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.
class.alt-description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form characterized by low, non-impact movements designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.

class.title: Beginning Yoga/Pilates
class.description: This combination course is designed for beginning and intermediate students. It will utilize low-impact aerobic warm-ups, poses and calisthenics to improve flexibility, balance and posture as well as equalize muscle strength throughout the body. Focus will be on breathing and relaxation.
class.alt-description: This combination course is designed for beginning and intermediate students. It will utilize low-impact aerobic warm-ups, poses and calisthenics to improve flexibility, balance and posture as well as equalize muscle strength throughout the body. Focus will be on breathing and relaxation.

class.title: Beginning Lifetime Sports Act.
class.description: This course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of the Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach basic techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at first class.

class.title: Conditioning Exercise
class.description: This beginning conditioning course designed for students 50 and older will incorporate a variety of exercises to improve cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, endurance and flexibility. Cardiovascular walking and rhythmic activities and weight training using small free weights and tubing are also included. Accommodation will be made for different levels of fitness.

class.title: Intermediate Tai Chi Chuan
class.description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form presented beyond the beginner level. It is designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.
class.alt-description: This course is an internal or soft Chinese martial art form presented beyond the beginner level. It is designed to build strength and balance and to reduce stress.

class.title: Inter Lifetime Sports Act
class.description: This intermediate conditioning course designed for students 50 and older will incorporate a variety of exercises to improve cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, endurance and flexibility. Cardiovascular walking and rhythmic activities and weight training using small free weights and tubing also are included. Accommodation will be made for different levels of fitness.

Cardiovascular walking and rhythmic activities and weight training using small free weights and tubing also are included. Accommodation will be made for different levels of fitness.

class.title: Intermediate Yoga/Pilates
class.description: This combination course is designed for beginning and intermediate students. It will utilize low-impact aerobic warm-ups, poses and calisthenics to improve flexibility, balance and posture as well as equalize muscle strength throughout the body. The focus will be on breathing and relaxation.

class.title: Fund Astronomy
class.description: Orientation for PHYS 1411-2426 online astronomy will be Jan. 17, from 6-7 p.m. in Room K251. Lectures, labs and tests are online. Some outdoor observations are required. PHYS 1411 is a Core Curriculum course for non-science majors and includes the study of planetary astronomy.

class.title: Digital Camera
class.description: POFI 1104-2203 will cover the various features of a digital camera. Students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2203 will cover the various features of a digital camera. Students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.

class.title: Digital Camera

class.title: Computer Literacy/Basic Skills
class.description: POFI 1104-2206 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. Students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing Computer Literacy, you will be ready to enroll in Intro to Computers/Windows XP or Vista.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2206 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. Students will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard, and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing Computer Literacy, you will be ready to enroll in Intro to Computers/Windows XP or Vista.

class.title: Advanced E-Mail
class.description: POFI 1104-2207 will explore how to use e-mail clients such as Outlook and Thunderbird, as well as using WebMail to check your bulk folder. In this six-session course, students will learn how to configure message filters, group lists, stationery, v-cards, signatures, encryption and attachments. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Internet I
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2207 will explore how to use e-mail clients such as Outlook and Thunderbird, as well as using WebMail to check your bulk folder. In this six-session course, students will learn how to configure message filters, group lists, stationery, v-cards, signatures, encryption and attachments. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Internet I

class.title: Photo Restoration
class.description: POFI 1104 2208 will help you preserve memories of the past. In this six-session course, you will learn to scan, rebuild, repair and salvage your vintage and other damaged photos using Photoshop Elements. Preserve and protect those memories for the future by archiving them in a digital format.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104 2208 will help you preserve memories of the past. In this six-session course, you will learn to scan, rebuild, repair and salvage your vintage and other damaged photos using Photoshop Elements. Preserve and protect those memories for the future by archiving them in a digital format.

class.title: Data Security
class.description: POFI 1104-2209 covers how to protect your personal computer from viruses, "phishing," hacker penetrations, "spoofing," hidden spyware and e-mail identity theft schemes. In this six-session course you will learn techniques to protect data stored on your computer, how to manage your passwords and reduce the amount of unwanted e-mail. You also will learn how to download and install free programs to protect yourself and your computer. Recommended Prerequisites: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2209 covers how to protect your personal computer from viruses, "phishing," hacker penetrations, "spoofing," hidden spyware and e-mail identity theft schemes. In this six-session course you will learn techniques to protect data stored on your computer, how to manage your passwords and reduce the amount of unwanted e-mail. You also will learn how to download and install free programs to protect yourself and your computer. Recommended Prerequisites: Intro to Windows

class.title: Excel 2007, Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2210 will develop skills in the basics of Microsoft Excel, a program for spreadsheet and arithmetic functions. This six-session course will include creating, editing, naming, saving, and printing spreadsheets; navigating within worksheets; menus, shortcuts and toolbars for formatting spreadsheets and writing basic formulas. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2210 will develop skills in the basics of Microsoft Excel, a program for spreadsheet and arithmetic functions. This six-session course will include creating, editing, naming, saving, and printing spreadsheets; navigating within worksheets; menus, shortcuts and toolbars for formatting spreadsheets and writing basic formulas. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows.

class.title: Internet Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2211 emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but will also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2211 emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but will also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Internet Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2212 emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but will also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2212 emphasizes all basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups, and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer, but will also discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Internet Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2213 will cover advanced e-mail functions, advanced searches, quick searches and shortcuts to addressing Web sites. Students will learn how to download programs such as games and Adobe Acrobat Reader. You also will learn how to manage pop-ups, spam mail, cookies and avoid viruses. How to personalize the Internet experience and use calendars also will be explained. Recommended Prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2213 will cover advanced e-mail functions, advanced searches, quick searches and shortcuts to addressing Web sites. Students will learn how to download programs such as games and Adobe Acrobat Reader. You also will learn how to manage pop-ups, spam mail, cookies and avoid viruses. How to personalize the Internet experience and use calendars also will be explained. Recommended Prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2214 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Students also will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2214 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Students also will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2215 will build on skills from Elements Part I and cover how to correct color and exposure as well as dust and spot removal. In this six-session course you also will use the clone tool to repair damage and remove unwanted parts of the photo. Recommended Prerequisite: Photoshop Elements I
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2215 will build on skills from Elements Part I and cover how to correct color and exposure as well as dust and spot removal. In this six-session course you also will use the clone tool to repair damage and remove unwanted parts of the photo. Recommended Prerequisite: Photoshop Elements I

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part III
class.description: POFI 1104-2216 will build on skills from Elements part II. Students will work on a project as well as learn different ways of creating masks to isolate specific areas of photos and how to work with various types of layers, including text layers. In this six-session course, you also will experiment with blend modes and plug-in filters. Required Prerequisite: Photoshop Elements II
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2216 will build on skills from Elements part II. Students will work on a project as well as learn different ways of creating masks to isolate specific areas of photos and how to work with various types of layers, including text layers. In this six-session course, you also will experiment with blend modes and plug-in filters. Required Prerequisite: Photoshop Elements II

class.title: Tips/Tricks
class.description: POFI 1104-2217 will deal with improving computer performance and avoiding or fixing problems. On the Windows XP desktop, students will learn to navigate, customize, organize, eliminate clutter and speed up the boot process. In Internet Explorer you will organize and manage Favorites, cookies, browser history and troubleshoot connection problems. In this six-session course tips will be given to help deal with spam in e-mail, organize what you want to keep and eliminate clutter. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2217 will deal with improving computer performance and avoiding or fixing problems. On the Windows XP desktop, students will learn to navigate, customize, organize, eliminate clutter and speed up the boot process. In Internet Explorer you will organize and manage Favorites, cookies, browser history and troubleshoot connection problems. In this six-session course, tips will be given to help deal with spam in e-mail, organize what you want to keep and eliminate clutter. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Users Group & Problem Solving
class.description: POFI 1104-2218 meets four times during the semester. Each session of this course will have a program and demonstrations to increase your knowledge of computers, computer software and the Internet. In addition students will have an opportunity to ask questions about various computer and software problems they have encountered. This course meets on Fridays, Feb.1, March 7, April 4 and May 2.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2218 meets four times during the semester. Each session of this course will have a program and demonstrations to increase your knowledge of computers, computer software and the Internet. In addition students will have an opportunity to ask questions about various computer and software problems they have encountered. This course meets on Fridays, Feb.1, March 7, April 4 and May 2.

class.title: Word 2007/Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2219 will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. This six-session course includes creating and editing Word documents, naming, saving and printing documents, menus, toolbars and shortcuts, formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text, margins, indents and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2219 will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. This six-session course includes creating and editing Word documents, naming, saving and printing documents, menus, toolbars and shortcuts, formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text, margins, indents and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Word 2007/Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2220 builds on the concepts learned in Word Part I to work with columns, paragraph numbering, graphics, section breaks and creating envelopes and labels. This six-session course will include how to merge a database of names and addresses into a standard "boilerplate" for mail merge will be covered, as well as how to change Word's default settings and refine your knowledge of advanced table techniques. Required prerequisite: Word/Part I
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2220 builds on the concepts learned in Word Part I to work with columns, paragraph numbering, graphics, section breaks and creating envelopes and labels. This six-session course will include how to merge a database of names and addresses into a standard "boilerplate" for mail merge will be covered, as well as how to change Word's default settings and refine your knowledge of advanced table techniques. Required prerequisite: Word/Part I

class.title: Music Player Basic Course
class.description: POFI 1104-2221 is a beginning course in the use of Windows Media Player 11 and Winamp. This six-session course will emphasize the basic functions of playing and managing audio files running under the Microsoft Windows operating system. You will learn to copy (rip) your own music CDs to the audio library and create (burn) copies of CDs for use on other audio players. How to manage the audio and video library will also be covered. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2221 is a beginning course in the use of Windows Media Player 11 and Winamp. This six-session course will emphasize the basic functions of playing and managing audio files running under the Microsoft Windows operating system. You will learn to copy (rip) your own music CDs to the audio library and create (burn) copies of CDs for use on other audio players. How to manage the audio and video library will also be covered. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Publisher 2007
class.description: POFI 1104-2223 will introduce the design of a variety of publications such as greeting cards, invitations, fliers, newsletters, postcards, calendars, business cards and signs. This six-session course also will cover predefined layouts that may be used to simplify formatting your publication if you do not design your own layout.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2223 will introduce the design of a variety of publications such as greeting cards, invitations, fliers, newsletters, postcards, calendars, business cards and signs. This six-session course also will cover predefined layouts that may be used to simplify formatting your publication if you do not design your own layout.

class.title: Income Tax
class.description: POFI 1104-2224 is a tax preparation course using H & R Block TaxCut software to prepare a typical Form 1040 Federal Income Tax return. This four-session course will include Social Security benefits, mutual fund distributions, interest and dividend income, IRA distributions, capital gains, pension income and 2007 estimated taxes. Students will be required to purchase the TaxCut software. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2224 is a tax preparation course using H & R Block TaxCut software to prepare a typical Form 1040 Federal Income Tax return. This four-session course will include Social Security benefits, mutual fund distributions, interest and dividend income, IRA distributions, capital gains, pension income and 2007 estimated taxes. Students will be required to purchase the TaxCut software. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows

class.title: Tracing Family Tree, Part II
class.description: POFI 1104-2225 will continue your fascinating genealogical journey of ancestral discovery. The instructor will guide students deeper into the labyrinth of traditional historical and genealogical records sources, research methods, Web sites and search engines.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2225 will continue your fascinating genealogical journey of ancestral discovery. The instructor will guide students deeper into the labyrinth of traditional historical and genealogical records sources, research methods, Web sites and search engines.

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2227 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Students will also develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2227 will help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Students will also develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: VISTA for XP Users
class.description: POFI 1104.2228 will cover the difference in Windows XP and Windows VISTA, some of the pitfalls/problems between the two operating systems, and how to determine if a program that ran on XP has been tested or not tested to run on VISTA.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104.2228 will cover the difference in Windows XP and Windows VISTA, some of the pitfalls/problems between the two operating systems, and how to determine if a program that ran on XP has been tested or not tested to run on VISTA.

class.title: Legacy Family Tree IV
class.description: Required prerequisite: Legacy Family Tree II. Students will bring their Family File to class and enter individuals, events, and sources during the class. Tips, tricks and techniques using events, source citations, locations, complex searches and customized reports will be discussed in the class.

class.title: Web Page Design, Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2254 will focus on designing a simple personal or business Web site and covers how to put photos online and create e-mail links. You will learn about free or inexpensive Web site hosting for your personal site. No prior knowledge of Web design is required. Students must be able to attend all five classes. Recommended Prerequisite: Intro to Windows & Internet, Part I

class.title: Web Page Design I
class.description: POFI 1104-2260 will focus on designing a simple personal or business Web site and will cover how to put photos online and create e-mail links. Free or inexpensive Web site hosting for personal use will be covered. Recommended prerequisite: Intro to Windows and Internet Part I.

class.title: Intro to Comp/Windows XP
class.description: POFI 1204-2200 is a beginning computer course that focuses on the terminology of the Microsoft Windows XP operating system. In this 12-session course, components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. Students will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.

In this 12-session course, components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. Students will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.

course.title: Spc Tpcs in Spanish Lang/Liter
course.long-title: Special Topics in Spanish Language and Literature

class.title: Beginnings Spanish Language
class.description: In this 10-week course you will build a beginning vocabulary, basic grammar and pronunciation skills. Comprehension will increase as you participate in listening and speaking exercises with classmates and the instructor. Instructional materials will be used as a way to increase skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: In this 10-week course you will build a beginning vocabulary, basic grammar and pronunciation skills. Comprehension will increase as you participate in listening and speaking exercises with classmates and the instructor. Instructional materials will be used as a way to increase skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.

class.title: Intermediate Spanish Language
class.description: Recommended Prerequisite: Beginning Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course is a continuation of Beginning Spanish and seeks to develop additional vocabulary and speaking skills. You will continue oral practice, as well as the reading, writing, and grammar skills necessary to enhance your communication and comprehension skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: Recommended Prerequisite: Beginning Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course is a continuation of Beginning Spanish and seeks to develop additional vocabulary and speaking skills. You will continue oral practice, as well as the reading, writing, and grammar skills necessary to enhance your communication and comprehension skills. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.

class.title: Special Topics in Spanish
class.description: RECOMMENDED PREREQUISITE: Intermediate Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course will include a grammar and vocabulary review, a survey of literature, current topics, cultural videos and discussion. New topics will be introduced each semester. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
class.alt-description: RECOMMENDED PREREQUISITE: Intermediate Spanish or permission of instructor. This 10-week course will include a grammar and vocabulary review, a survey of literature, current topics, cultural videos and discussion. New topics will be introduced each semester. Additional work may be done on a self-paced basis outside of class.
